intro: Cardiolepis nigra, commonly known as blackleaf sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often forming dense stands in swampy areas. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a dark green to almost black coloration. The flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family.
